item.title: 新消息：拜登政府以潜在的国家安全风险为由，表示将对中国制造的 "智能汽车 "进行调查。

item.title: 据当局称，一名加拿大游客在夏威夷一条偏僻的公路上拐错了弯，将租来的汽车开下了 60 英尺高的悬崖，幸好他还活着。

item.title: 海洋探险安全：美国广播公司新闻调查发现，自 2016 年海洋探险公司首家水族馆开业以来，至少发生了 75 起人们在不同的海洋探险地点被动物伤害的事件。
item.description:
SEAQUEST SAFETY: An ABC News investigation has found at least 75 incidents where people have reported being injured by animals at various SeaQuest locations since the company's first aquarium opened in 2016. https://t.co/EobRb0LqAk pic.twitter.com/CrnhKuzpFT

— ABC News (@ABC) February 29, 2024

item.title: 上传到社交媒体上的视频显示，得克萨斯州潘汉德尔地区的野火仍在燃烧，建筑物被完全摧毁。快速移动的大风助长了爆炸性野火，促使该州 60 个县宣布发生灾难。
item.description:
Footage uploaded to social media shows flames still burning and structures completely destroyed by a wildfire in the Texas Panhandle. The explosive wildfires fueled by fast-moving winds prompted a disaster declaration for 60 counties in the state. https://t.co/oX8xlu1iFL pic.twitter.com/nSBjFV5M6j

— ABC News (@ABC) February 29, 2024

item.title: 阿拉巴马州最高法院做出的一项将冷冻胚胎归类为人的决定引起了人们对生育治疗（尤其是体外受精）未来的担忧。
item.description:
A decision by the Alabama Supreme Court classifying frozen embryos as people has caused concerns over the future of fertility treatments, specifically in vitro fertilization.

Here are five things to know about IVF and its impact on reproductive health. https://t.co/ui4J2RoY22

— ABC News (@ABC) February 29, 2024

item.title: 根据计划生育协会发布的 "WeCount "报告中收集的数据，研究人员估计，在罗伊法案被推翻后的头 15 个月里，有超过 12 万人无法从本州的医疗服务提供者那里获得堕胎护理。
item.description:
Researchers estimate more than 120,000 people were not able to get abortion care from a provider in their state in the first 15 months after Roe was overturned, according to data gathered in the WeCount report released by the Society of Family Planning. https://t.co/irfrnb0TPJ

— ABC News (@ABC) February 29, 2024
